sentences.en: a meagre diet of bread and beans
sentences.cn: 不足以果腹的面包和豆子

sentences.en: a meagre diet of bread and water
sentences.cn: 只有面包和水的粗茶淡饭

sentences.en: An unjust cause finds meagre [ little ] support .
He was so weak from hunger he could hardly raise his meagre arms.
sentences.cn: 他饿得虚弱无力,连骨瘦如柴的胳膊都举不起来.

sentences.en: His knowledge of Chinese history is meagre.
sentences.cn: 他的中国历史知识很贫乏.

sentences.en: In his plain old suit of black, he looked pale and meagre.
sentences.cn: 穿上一套朴素的黑色衣服, 他越发显得苍白而瘦弱.

sentences.en: Our appeal for help met with a meagre response.
sentences.cn: 我们求助的呼吁反应冷淡.

sentences.en: Our knowledge regarding the effects of ionizing radiations is still meagre.
sentences.cn: 我们关于电离辐射效应的知识仍很不足.

sentences.en: Particulars are too meagre to form a decision.
sentences.cn: 详情不明,难以作出裁断.

sentences.en: The bank's staff were already angered by a meagre 3.1% pay rise.
sentences.cn: 银行职员对只加薪3.1%已心生怒火。

sentences.en: The diet should be suitable, being neither too rich nor too meagre.
sentences.cn: 膳食应该适当, 即不能太油腻也不能太粗淡.

sentences.en: The injured climbers had only meagre supplies of water and peanuts to live off.
sentences.cn: 受伤的登山者只剩下少量的水和花生赖以生存.

sentences.en: The meagre Latin class recited with honor.
sentences.cn: 寥寥数人的拉丁语班背诵时显得无比自豪.

sentences.en: The rations that they gave us were meagre and inadequate.
sentences.cn: 他们给我们的配给量是很少的，是不够的。

sentences.en: The resources of New York are rather meagre.
sentences.cn: 纽约的娱乐场所太少了.

sentences.en: The show is drawing but a meagre audience.
sentences.cn: 看演出的观众寥寥无几.

trans.tran_cn: 瘦的，贫弱的，思想贫乏的，土地不毛的
trans.tran_en: If you describe an amount or quantity of something as meagre, you are critical of it because it is very small or not enough
